intro: Stylidium breviscapum, commonly known as the short-stalked triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive trigger mechanism in its flowers, which facilitates pollination by insects. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, bright red or orange flowers are clustered in dense spikes, making it a striking addition to gardens. Stylidium breviscapum is also known for its rapid growth and ability to attract a variety of pollinators.
